usefulItems: cling film or tea towel, baking tray (approx. 40 cm x 35 cm), baking paper, oven
title: Pizza Margherita

ingredients.content: extra virgin olive oil, for greasing
10 - 15 fresh basil leaves, torn in pieces

preparations.content: Lightly grease a large bowl and set aside. Place water, sugar and yeast in mixing bowl then mix <b>20 sec/speed 2<b>.

Add flour, oil and salt then knead <b>2 min/<b>. Place dough in prepared bowl and form into a ball. Cover bowl with cling film or a damp tea towel and let dough rise until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour).
Preheat oven to 230°C. Line a baking tray (approx. 40 cm x 35 cm) with baking paper or grease with oil and set aside.
Place mozzarella in mixing bowl and grate <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer to simmering basket and leave to drain for 10 minutes.
Place dough on prepared baking tray and shape into a rectangle the size of the baking tray by pressing it with your finger tips and stretching it gently. Form a small ridge around the edges.

Spread chopped tomatoes and mozzarella on top of dough then sprinkle with salt, olive oil and 5-7 torn basil leaves. Bake pizza for 20 minutes (230°C). Scatter additional 5-8 torn basil leaves (to taste) over pizza and serve hot.

hintsAndTricks: Add your favourite toppings (e.g. vegetables, salami, ham, cheese, fruit, herbs).
Alternatively, roll pizza dough out on a floured surface using a rolling pin, and transfer dough to prepared baking tray.
<b>4 individual<b> round pizzas can be made from the dough. Italians bake them one at a time and share each pizza as it comes fresh out of the oven.
In <b>step 2<b> lightly oil the cling film to prevent it from sticking to the rising dough.
If mozzarella is dry there is no need to drain it.
If chopped tomatoes have a lot of liquid, drain through simmering basket before using.
